Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for Fair / Messe”
Reviews.Author: Dfernandezm
Reviews.Content: Excellent breakfast and located 700m. away from Berlin Messe. No restaurant but a few good options around

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation with good value”
Reviews.Author: Phyt0n
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel as "last minute" choice when visiting IFA show and it turned out that it was a very good choice because IFA entrance was ~5 minutes of walk from the hotel. In the near You can find also a subway station and Cancun restaurant with very good service. ;-) The hotel supports You with an elevator, underground parking lot (paid), Wi-Fi Internet, breakfast (a wide choice of food tastes), a reception desk with fluent English, pretty comfortable beds and clean bathroom. Because the subway is not so far You can use it also as a very good sleeping point if You want to make Berlin sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “this is our Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Gintaz
Reviews.Content: Very kind and friendly ladies in reception and breakfast room. Wonderfull view from breakfast room, excellent breakfast. Clientorientiering hotel. 3 min. walking from public transport- ubahn, sbahn and city bus.

Reviews.Title: “A recommendable hotel”
Reviews.Author: cactie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on the edge of the city, but the subway station or the bus stop is only 5 minutes' walk. The room was clean and quiet during our stay. The WLAN didn't work on the first day, but after we reported the problem, it worked again. The staffs were always friendliy. We paid only EUR 87 for 3 nights, in view of the excellent service, the hotel has really good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ameliana
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in August 2008. For the price I paid I got more than my expectations. The room was new, nice and clean, and not to say the breakfast was impressive. The hotel was also close to the U-bahn, and just a few minutes away from the Zoologischer Garten (town centre). I am soon coming back to Berlin and have already booked my bed at Concorde am Studio.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for ICC and Messe Berlin visitors”
Reviews.Author: Tero Lehto
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Concorde Studio Am Berlin for three days in August during the IFA fair event. The hotel has an ideal location for that, just a five minutes walk from the Messe Berlin / ICC south gate. For a business traveller, there was an affordable internet connection in rooms. It mostly worked very well. Breakfast was better than average even though I went as late as 10:30 am, continental with bacon, ham, sausages, salami, cheese, cerials, yoghurts, very good fresh juice, coffee served to your table and so on. There's a nice small bar with some drinks and small snack. The closest metro station is less than five minutes from the hotel. I found enough good and affordable restaurants nearby. This is a good place to stay for anyone going to the ICC or Messe Berlin for work. However, as the rooms are small and there's no air conditioning and the bed wasn't that good, I wouldn't choose this hotel for one week's trip or longer.

Reviews.Title: “OK except for no air conditioning!”
Reviews.Author: trustenp
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June and July of 2005. OK, so I'm an "ugly American," but in the U.S., we expect air conditioning in the summertime, vending machines with snacks and soda, and comfortable beds. This hotel had none of these things. True, Germany is at the latitude of Newfoundland, and air conditioning may not be necessary, but the sun was absolutely ROASTING this hotel when I was there, and I had to sleep with a wet cloth on my face to get any rest. Soda was available, but only in a "mini-bar" (actually a kind of cooler with no power, so the soda was barely cool). The only snacks available were from a convenience store across Kaiserdamm, and then only through a little window after hours. The bed felt like a prop from a window dresser's equipment shop: very thin, fit for placing a mannequin on, not a hotel guest. I will say that the room was clean and the bathroom also quite clean and well-equipped. I suppose you could call it a bargain in Berlin for EUR 65 (at the time, USD 76 per night), but had I known what was missing, I'd have sought a better spot to stay for some extra money, since this was my first visit to the country. A friend in the city chose this hotel for me, because it was near her house.

Reviews.Title: “OK for low budget”
Reviews.Author: WorldwideTraveler001
Reviews.Content: Stayed there during the world cup as it is very close to the underground which takes only 10 min to the city and Olympic stadium. However it is for lower budgets, rooms are very small but look recently refurbished and clean. Breakfast service was friendly and you find a good choice of international standard brfst. All in all OK for the low price.

HotelInfo.Name: Concorde Hotel am Studio
HotelInfo.Address: Kaiserdamm 80-81, 14057 Berlin, Germany
